intro: Asperula lutea var. abbreviata, commonly known as the dwarf yellow woodruff, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact habit and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic, with a hairy surface, and the plant thrives in shaded, moist environments. It is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover due to its ornamental value and ability to spread readily.
